verdict.summary: OpenSSL 3.0 in Node.js 17+ removed support for legacy crypto algorithms (like MD4, old hash functions). Code or dependencies using these algorithms fail.

dead_ends.why_fails: This is a temporary workaround that re-enables insecure algorithms; it will eventually stop working in future Node.js versions and masks security vulnerabilities
Node.js 16 is end-of-life and no longer receives security patches; this trades one problem for a worse one

workarounds.action: Update the dependency that uses the legacy algorithm to a newer version
workarounds.how: Identify which package triggers the error from the stack trace, then npm update or npm install <package>@latest

workarounds.action: Use --openssl-legacy-provider as a temporary bridge while upgrading dependencies
workarounds.how: NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider node app.js â€” use only as a short-term workaround
workarounds.condition: when immediate fix is needed and dependency upgrade is not yet possible

leads_to.condition: when switching crypto algorithms without updating IV length

preceded_by.condition: often the same root cause with different error formatting

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ERR_OSSL_EVP_UNSUPPORTED means the algorithm itself is disabled in OpenSSL 3.0, while invalid IV length means the algorithm is supported but called with wrong parameters
